intro.description:
The Abstract Syntax Model is written in ecore and can used all the standard EMF tools based on ecore definition.
This cheatsheet will show you where and how this model is defined and used by EMF tools.

item.title: Open fr.irisa.triskell.kmlogo.model project
item.description: This project contains the basis of the Logo DSL.

item.title: Open ASMLogo.ecore (using EMF tree editor)
item.description:
in the "model" folder, there is ASMLogo.ecore.
This is a standard ecore file.

item.title: Open ASMLogo.ecoredi
item.description:
As a standard ecore file, any ecore aware tools can be used to visualize it.
Here we used Topcased ecore modeler to display a class diagram of our metamodel.

item.title: Overview of Logo language instructions
item.description:
In this ecore file you'll notice the various instructions supported by the DSL we are building.
Some are primitives, for example : Back, Forward, Left, PenUp, ...
Some are expressions, for example : Plus, Minus, ...
And some are control structures, for example : If, while, Repeat, ...
